llm.feedback: The draft lacks canonical handle mapping (spx), magnitude ranges, and precise catalyst windows; probabilities are inconsistent with the 60 % decline base case. 1) Add “spx” to every line and include a ± range (e.g., “spx +3‑5%” or “spx –5 to –10%”). 2) Replace generic “Fed rate cuts combined with easing inflation” with a specific catalyst window (Sep 17 2025 Fed meeting, Aug 30 PCE, Aug 31 NFP) and cite (Z7O1DCHS7). 3) For the labor‑market/tariff up case, link directly to spx, give a tighter magnitude (spx +1‑3%), and cite (FAN5RYW6T). 4) For the weak‑tech‑earnings down case, specify the spread widening threshold (>30 bp), give magnitude (spx –5 to –10%), and cite (FAN5RYW6T). 5) Adjust probabilities: up scenarios 86 % (Fed cuts) and 20 % (labor/tariff); down scenarios 60 % (sticky inflation) and 40 % (weak tech earnings). 6) Ensure each line remains a single sentence and includes the required format: “Up/Down | 3‑6 months | Driver | What to watch | Probability %”.
